title: How to simplify the Boolean expression (A+B) (Ā+C) (B+C) - Quora

response.answer_text: AC+ BC + BA’ details you can use a brute force method where you expand out all the terms which I will do later or you can use a more intuitive method The intuitive method ( I use A’ for A not) For this expression (A +B)(A’ +C)(B+C) to be true all terms in parenthesis must be true if A is true the first term is true and C makes the second and third terms true So you have (A)(C)(C)= AC being an answer But the first term is true if B is true and As makes the second term true, the B term makes the third term true So (B)(A’)(B) = A’B is also an answer If B is true and C is true all three terms are true (B)(C)(B+C) = BC Thus AC+ BC + A’B makes the above statement true The brute force method works as follows expand the first two terms (A +B)(A’ +C)(A+ B) = ( AA’ +AC + BA’ + BC)(A + B)now AA’=0 expand again (AC + BA’+ BC)(A+B) = AAC + BA’A + ABC +ABC +BBA’ + BBC AAC = AC, BA’A =0, BBA’ = BA’, and BBC = BC, two ABC terms are redundant AC + ABC +BA’ +BC AC(1 + B) + BA’ +BC = AC + BA’ +BC same as we got earlier

[math] F = (A+B)(A'+C)(B+C) [/math] [math] (A+B)(B+C) = AB + BB + AC + BC = AC + B [/math] [math] F = (AC+B)(A'+C) [/math] You can put this in a sum of products form if you want. [math] F = AA'C + A'B + ACC + BC [/math] [math] F = AC + A'B + BC [/math]
